creator: covener@gmail.com
text:
I think during a graceful restart of httpd, apr_ldap_rebind_init() can use a removed/invalid mutex because it won't create a new threadmutex when it gets initialized again.

During some unrelated testing, I saw a loop in the rebind callback list which I think this is the root cause of.  No return code is checked on the apr_thread_mutex_lock() but the lock appears to be returning EINVAL, presumably with a cleaned-up mutex.
